files.patch:
@@ -7,7 +7,9 @@ dashedName: step-9
 
 # --description--
 
-Below the block quotation element, add a paragraph element with the text `—Quincy Larson, How to Learn to Code and Get a Developer Job [Full Book]`.
+Below the block quotation element, add a paragraph element with the text `—Quincy Larson, How to Learn to Code and Get a Developer Job [Full Book]`.
+
+`—` is an HTML entity that represents an em dash `—`.
 
 # --hints--
 
@@ -17,11 +19,15 @@ You should have a `p` element below the `blockquote` element.
 assert.exists(document.querySelector('section:first-of-type > blockquote + p'));
 ```
 
-Your `p` element should have the text `—Quincy Larson, How to Learn to Code and Get a Developer Job [Full Book]`.
+Your `p` element should have the text `—Quincy Larson, How to Learn to Code and Get a Developer Job [Full Book]`.
 
 ```js
 const pEl = document.querySelector('section:first-of-type > blockquote + p');
-assert.equal(pEl?.innerText.trim(), '—Quincy Larson, How to Learn to Code and Get a Developer Job [Full Book]');
+const html = pEl?.innerHTML.trim();
+assert.oneOf(html, [
+  '—Quincy Larson, How to Learn to Code and Get a Developer Job [Full Book]',
+  '—Quincy Larson, How to Learn to Code and Get a Developer Job [Full Book]' 
+]);
 ```
 
 # --seed--

@@ -9,7 +9,7 @@ dashedName: step-7
 
 Now it is time to see the results of trimming whitespace at the beginning of the string.
 
-Below your `trimmedStart` variable, add a `console.log()` with the string `"After using the trimStart() method — leading spaces removed:"`. 
+Below your `trimmedStart` variable, add a `console.log()` with the string `"After using the trimStart() method, leading spaces removed:"`. 
 
 Then below that `console.log()`, add another `console.log()` with the `trimmedStart` variable.
 
@@ -22,10 +22,10 @@ const getLogs = () => spy.calls.map(call => call?.[0]);
 
 # --hints--
 
-You should log the string `"After using the trimStart() method — leading spaces removed:"` to the console.
+You should log the string `"After using the trimStart() method, leading spaces removed:"` to the console.
 
 ```js
-assert.equal(getLogs()[4], "After using the trimStart() method — leading spaces removed:");
+assert.equal(getLogs()[4], "After using the trimStart() method, leading spaces removed:");
 ```
 
 You should log the `trimmedStart` variable to the console.
